resources.string: Over 140 stations to pick up and rent the bicycle.
Several metro stations; Start e.g. at Kungsträdgården station.
Several locations; E.g. Olof Palmes gata 23
Roomescape by Fox in a Box

"A large nature reserve only 15 min bus ride from the city. Different hiking routes, swimming areas, saunas, restaurant, cabins to rent, barbecue areas, minigolf… And vast amount of winter activities too. "
Beautiful natural reserve for hiking and other free outdoor activities. Vast area covers several different lengthened routes, cafeterias, swimming areas, and animal farms.
There are numerous outdoor gyms all around Stockholm area. They are equipped with instructions, are completely free to use, and are in a good condition.

Stockholm is a green city, and people love to spend time outside whenever it is possible; eating, playing, or just relaxing. The parks are free for anyone, and are often provided with garbage bins, toilettes and even recycle bins just for disposable barbeques.
There is no better way to explore the city than on a bike. By purchasing a bike card with a fare price, bicycle is ready to be rented for max 3 hours in a row.
A classic food market hall since 1880s, where traditional delicacies from all around the world can be found, from Finland to Italy.
Royal soldiers marching, often with a band and horses, can be seen several times a week in the heart of Stockholm. The easiest place to spot them is in front of the Royal Palace (Kunglika Slottet).
A beautiful outdoor museum, with old fashioned buildings, animals, and idyllic little shops and cafeterias.
Founded in 1819, the Natural History Museum (Naturhistoriska Riksmuseet) in Stockholm provides lots of varying exhibitions and educational movies about the history of our Earth. Free entry.
Sculptures, mosaic, drawings and other art in 90 out of 100 subway stations make Stockholm metro lines an over 100 km long art exhibition.

This cozy cafeteria looks like a garden inside and serves vast amount of delicious food and lovely atmosphere to sit and relax. On weekends they also serve soup and waffle buffet, where you can eat as much as you like and make your own waffles.
An iconic cafeteria from all the way from 1700s is a definitely worth to visit. Their kanelbullar (cinnamon buns) are classics!
This restaurant is located at the no. 1 shopping street in Stockholm. Despite the central location, it serves good food with reasonable prices. Tip: Try their traditional Swedish meatballs!
One of the most famous hot dog stands in the city. Serves variety of different sausages, meat and spices. Be prepared for a long que, especially during lunch hours.
Handmade, delicious dumplings with good prices.
A cozy karaoke place with nice staff. Rent your own karaoke room for 4 – 30 people and start singing!
A popular laser game place in a centre of Stockholm.
A cute minigolf place in beautiful Kristineberg area. Instead of plastic, the obstacles in the course are made of stone, presenting old classic books.
With a small fee for jackets, enjoy both Swedish and English stand-up comedy several times a week in this iconic pub.
The most highly ranked escape room provider in Stockholm.
